channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI • Open Source • Security • Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.title: RondoDox Botnet Exploits Critical React2Shell Flaw to Hijack IoT Devices and Web Servers
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed details of a persistent nine-month-long campaign that has targeted Internet of Things (IoT) devices and web applications to enroll them into a botnet known as RondoDox. As of December 2025, the activity has been observed leveraging the recently disclosed...

item.title: The Drill-Down and Fabricate Test (DDFT): A Protocol for Measuring Epistemic Robustness in Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2512.23850v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Current language model evaluations measure what models know under ideal conditions but not how robustly they know it under realistic stress. Static benchmarks like MMLU and TruthfulQA cannot distinguish a model that lacks knowledge from one whose...

item.title: CASCADE: Cumulative Agentic Skill Creation through Autonomous Development and Evolution
item.description: arXiv:2512.23880v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language model (LLM) agents currently depend on predefined tools or brittle tool generation, constraining their capability and adaptability to complex scientific tasks. We introduce CASCADE, a self-evolving agentic framework representing an...

item.title: A Proof-of-Concept for Explainable Disease Diagnosis Using Large Language Models and Answer Set Programming
item.description: arXiv:2512.23932v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Accurate disease prediction is vital for timely intervention, effective treatment, and reducing medical complications. While symbolic AI has been applied in healthcare, its adoption remains limited due to the effort required for constructing...

item.title: SPARK: Search Personalization via Agent-Driven Retrieval and Knowledge-sharing
item.description: arXiv:2512.24008v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Personalized search demands the ability to model users' evolving, multi-dimensional information needs; a challenge for systems constrained by static profiles or monolithic retrieval pipelines. We present SPARK (Search Personalization via Agent-Driven...

item.title: ROAD: Reflective Optimization via Automated Debugging for Zero-Shot Agent Alignment
item.description: arXiv:2512.24040v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Automatic Prompt Optimization (APO) has emerged as a critical technique for enhancing Large Language Model (LLM) performance, yet current state-of-the-art methods typically rely on large, labeled gold-standard development sets to compute fitness...

item.title: Network Traffic Analysis with Process Mining: The UPSIDE Case Study
item.description: arXiv:2512.23718v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Online gaming is a popular activity involving the adoption of complex systems and network infrastructures. The relevance of gaming, which generates large amounts of market revenue, drove research in modeling network devices' behavior to evaluate...

item.title: A Comprehensive Study of Deep Learning Model Fixing Approaches
item.description: arXiv:2512.23745v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Deep Learning (DL) has been widely adopted in diverse industrial domains, including autonomous driving, intelligent healthcare, and aided programming. Like traditional software, DL systems are also prone to faults, whose malfunctioning may expose...

item.title: A Review of Diffusion-based Simulation-Based Inference: Foundations and Applications in Non-Ideal Data Scenarios
item.description: arXiv:2512.23748v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: For complex simulation problems, inferring parameters of scientific interest often precludes the use of classical likelihood-based techniques due to intractable likelihood functions. Simulation-based inference (SBI) methods forego the need for...

item.title: Coordinate Matrix Machine: A Human-level Concept Learning to Classify Very Similar Documents
item.description: arXiv:2512.23749v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Human-level concept learning argues that humans typically learn new concepts from a single example, whereas machine learning algorithms typically require hundreds of samples to learn a single concept. Our brain subconsciously identifies important...

item.title: Geometric Scaling of Bayesian Inference in LLMs
item.description: arXiv:2512.23752v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent work has shown that small transformers trained in controlled "wind-tunnel'' settings can implement exact Bayesian inference, and that their training dynamics produce a geometric substrate -- low-dimensional value manifolds and progressively...

item.title: Enriching Historical Records: An OCR and AI-Driven Approach for Database Integration
item.description: arXiv:2512.23710v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This research digitizes and analyzes the Leidse hoogleraren en lectoren 1575-1815 books written between 1983 and 1985, which contain biographic data about professors and curators of Leiden University. It addresses the central question: how can we...

item.title: CAT: A Metric-Driven Framework for Analyzing the Consistency-Accuracy Relation of LLMs under Controlled Input Variations
item.description: arXiv:2512.23711v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce \textsc{CAT}, a framework designed to evaluate and visualize the \emph{interplay} of \emph{accuracy} and \emph{response consistency} of Large Language Models (LLMs) under controllable input variations, using multiple-choice (MC)...

item.title: STED and Consistency Scoring: A Framework for Evaluating LLM Structured Output Reliability
item.description: arXiv:2512.23712v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) are increasingly deployed for structured data generation, yet output consistency remains critical for production applications. We introduce a comprehensive framework for evaluating and improving consistency in...

item.title: PyBangla at BLP-2025 Task 2: Enhancing Bangla-to-Python Code Generation with Iterative Self-Correction and Multilingual Agents
item.description: arXiv:2512.23713v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: LLMs excel at code generation from English prompts, but this progress has not extended to low-resource languages. We address Bangla-to-Python code generation by introducing BanglaCodeAct, an agent-based framework that leverages multi-agent prompting...

item.title: PharmaShip: An Entity-Centric, Reading-Order-Supervised Benchmark for Chinese Pharmaceutical Shipping Documents
item.description: arXiv:2512.23714v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present PharmaShip, a real-world Chinese dataset of scanned pharmaceutical shipping documents designed to stress-test pre-trained text-layout models under noisy OCR and heterogeneous templates. PharmaShip covers three complementary tasks-sequence...

item.title: Zhipu Advances Malaysia’s Sovereign AI Initiative
item.description: Zhipu is supporting Malaysia’s sovereign AI strategy by powering a national MaaS platform and AI talent lab optimized for multilingual use and data sovereignty.

item.title: Dreame to Debut Its First Smart Ring and Thumb-Sized Action Camera at CES 2026
item.description: At CES 2026, Dreame will expand beyond cleaning appliances by debuting its first smart ring and a thumb-sized action camera, signaling a broader push into consumer electronics.

item.title: LandSpace’s STAR Market IPO Application Accepted, Seeking Around USD 1.05 Billion to Bet on Reusable Rockets
item.description: LandSpace has taken a major step toward public markets, seeking RMB 7.5 billion on China’s STAR Market to scale up reusable rocket technology amid growing policy support for commercial space.

item.title: CATL Builds 1,325 Battery Swap Stations in One Year, Cutting Energy Costs to About $0.014 per Kilometer
item.description: CATL is rapidly scaling battery swapping across China, cutting EV energy costs to as low as $0.014 per kilometer while building one of the world’s largest swap networks.

item.title: Kimi Raises $500M in Series C, Cash Reserves Exceed RMB 10 Billion
item.description: Kimi’s $500 million Series C highlights surging global demand for advanced reasoning models and cements Moonshot AI’s position among China’s top AI startups.

item.title: Trust Wallet Chrome Extension Hack Drains $8.5M via Shai-Hulud Supply Chain Attack
item.description: Trust Wallet on Tuesday revealed that the second iteration of the Shai-Hulud (aka Sha1-Hulud) supply chain outbreak in November 2025 was likely responsible for the hack of its Google Chrome extension, ultimately resulting in the theft of approximately $8.5 million in assets. "Our Developer GitHub...

item.title: DarkSpectre Browser Extension Campaigns Exposed After Impacting 8.8 Million Users Worldwide
item.description: The threat actor behind two malicious browser extension campaigns, ShadyPanda and GhostPoster, has been attributed to a third attack campaign codenamed DarkSpectre that has impacted 2.2 million users of Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, and Mozilla Firefox. The activity is assessed to be the work of a...

item.title: SpaceTimePilot: Generative Rendering of Dynamic Scenes Across Space and Time
item.description: We present SpaceTimePilot, a video diffusion model that disentangles space and time for controllable generative rendering. Given a monocular video, SpaceTimePilot can independently alter the camera viewpoint and the motion sequence within the generative process, re-rendering the scene for...

item.title: Scaling Open-Ended Reasoning to Predict the Future
item.description: High-stakes decision making involves reasoning under uncertainty about the future. In this work, we train language models to make predictions on open-ended forecasting questions. To scale up training data, we synthesize novel forecasting questions from global events reported in daily news, using a...

item.title: IBM Warns of Critical API Connect Bug Allowing Remote Authentication Bypass
item.description: IBM has disclosed details of a critical security flaw in API Connect that could allow attackers to gain remote access to the application. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-13915, is rated 9.8 out of a maximum of 10.0 on the CVSS scoring system. It has been described as an authentication bypass...

item.title: Researchers Spot Modified Shai-Hulud Worm Testing Payload on npm Registry
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed details of what appears to be a new strain of Shai Hulud on the npm registry with slight modifications from the previous wave observed last month. The npm package that embeds the novel Shai Hulud strain is "@vietmoney/react-big-calendar," which was uploaded...

item.title: Shai-Hulud Supply Chain Attack Led to $8.5 Million Trust Wallet Heist
item.description: The worm exposed Trust Wallet’s Developer GitHub secrets, allowing attackers to publish a backdoor extension and steal funds from 2,520 wallets. The post Shai-Hulud Supply Chain Attack Led to $8.5 Million Trust Wallet Heist appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Why inventing new emotions feels so good
item.description: Have you ever felt “velvetmist”?  It’s a “complex and subtle emotion that elicits feelings of comfort, serenity, and a gentle sense of floating.” It’s peaceful, but more ephemeral and intangible than contentment. It might be evoked by the sight of a sunset or a moody, low-key album.   If...

item.title: European Space Agency Confirms Breach After Hacker Offers to Sell Data
item.description: The European Space Agency is conducting an investigation and says external science servers have been compromised. The post European Space Agency Confirms Breach After Hacker Offers to Sell Data appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: PhyGDPO: Physics-Aware Groupwise Direct Preference Optimization for Physically Consistent Text-to-Video Generation
item.description: Recent advances in text-to-video (T2V) generation have achieved good visual quality, yet synthesizing videos that faithfully follow physical laws remains an open challenge. Existing methods mainly based on graphics or prompt extension struggle to generalize beyond simple simulated environments or...

item.title: Forging Spatial Intelligence: A Roadmap of Multi-Modal Data Pre-Training for Autonomous Systems
item.description: The rapid advancement of autonomous systems, including self-driving vehicles and drones, has intensified the need to forge true Spatial Intelligence from multi-modal onboard sensor data. While foundation models excel in single-modal contexts, integrating their capabilities across diverse sensors...

item.title: 8 Cybersecurity Acquisitions Surpassed $1 Billion Mark in 2025
item.description: The total disclosed value for all the cybersecurity M&A deals announced in 2025 exceeded $84 billion. The post 8 Cybersecurity Acquisitions Surpassed $1 Billion Mark in 2025 appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: The ascent of the AI therapist
item.description: We’re in the midst of a global mental-­health crisis. More than a billion people worldwide suffer from a mental-health condition, according to the World Health Organization. The prevalence of anxiety and depression is growing in many demographics, particularly young people, and suicide is claiming...

item.title: Figure It Out: Improving the Frontier of Reasoning with Active Visual Thinking
item.description: Complex reasoning problems often involve implicit spatial, geometric, and structural relationships that are not explicitly encoded in text. While recent reasoning models have achieved strong performance across many domains, purely text-based reasoning struggles to represent global structural...

item.title: Chinese APT Mustang Panda Caught Using Kernel-Mode Rootkit
item.description: The threat actor uses a signed driver file containing two user-mode shellcodes to execute its ToneShell backdoor. The post Chinese APT Mustang Panda Caught Using Kernel-Mode Rootkit appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Korean Air Data Compromised in Oracle EBS Hack
item.description: Roughly 30,000 Korean Air employees had their data stolen by hackers in a breach at former subsidiary KC&D. The post Korean Air Data Compromised in Oracle EBS Hack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Happy 16th Birthday, KrebsOnSecurity.com!
item.description: KrebsOnSecurity.com celebrates its 16th anniversary today! A huge "thank you" to all of our readers -- newcomers, long-timers and drive-by critics alike. Your engagement this past year here has been tremendous and truly a salve on a handful of dark days. Happily, comeuppance was a strong theme...

item.title: Bangladesh’s garment-making industry is getting greener
item.description: Pollution from textile production—dyes, chemicals, and heavy metals like lead and cadmium—is common in the waters of the Buriganga River as it runs through Dhaka, Bangladesh. It’s among many harms posed by a garment sector that was once synonymous with tragedy: In 2013, the eight-story Rana Plaza...
